column13: Our experience at 49 West was delightful. From our very efficient and helpful waiter to the superior quality of the fresh food, no complaints. The crab cake made with lump crab meat was excellent. We had never tried celery root salad (the waiter recommended it for our sides). We loved it. Their Key Lime pie was excellent. I would definitely go there again.

Consistently good food - we go there a lot for lunch and dinner. This evening we enjoyed burger night special, and also that special summer salad. There was a pleasant crowd there on a Monday night in February and it was not noisy.
MUST try the sweet potatoe cocktail! absolutely AMMMMMMMAZZZING! Pork cheek is also out of the world delic!
the best greak restaurant in the area
delicious fresh food. we love it here.

The food was delicious, hearty fare, the price reasonable. It is a small restaurant with a bar upstairs and seating for maybe 50 downstairs. The owners are very present and made a special point of stopping by our table to introduce themselves and make sure everything was as expected.
The service was great but I don't feel that the food was worth the expense. This is not a "bad" spot, but we will not be going back.

The food did not quite live up to the expectations seat by the menu, but it is good, reliable tavern fare. The service was terrific and the beer selection was pretty good, too. The bin full of toys and room to move made it very kid-friendly, though I'm not sure that patrons without kids appreciated that. If going with kids, it may be best to go early.

column4: 2700 Turf Valley Road Ellicott City, MD  21042
column13: The food and ambiance were great! They also had a jazz band, which set the mood also.
The pizza appetizer was similar to frozen pizza. The fried chicken was extremely dry and inedible and the seafood risotto had no flavor. Wine list was good and service was alright.

column4: 9712 Groffs Mill Drive Owings Mills, MD  21117
column13: Great experience and flavorful food

We have been enjoying Amicci's for many years now. It is one of our favorite restaurants in Baltimore. The food is consistently delicious, the service is wonderful and the staff is very friendly. Love the ambience of the little Italian restaurant with all the posters, etc. We highly recommend this restaurant!

As others have noted, the noise level is loud partly because of acoustics and partly because of the vibrant happy hour that lasts until 7-so it takes awhile for that partying sound to wind down. Other than that our food was good (except for the fat in the ribs and brisket). I won't order the ribs again. Maybe they should find out where Adam's orders their ribs!

column4: 9433 Common Brook Rd. Owings Mills, MD  21117
column13: The first in our party of 4 to arrive were seated at a table and ordered beverages. When we arrived, we requested a booth and the manager accommodated us immediately and even replaced the early arrivals' beverages with fresh ones. Our server was friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, and very attentive. All of us enjoyed the meal and the visit. Always a pleasant experience.

We had a hotel block in the Westin for our wedding from the night before. Many of our guests were eating breakfast/brunch at Azure the next morning, so there was a lot of activity. The staff didn't get frazzled and took really good care of us!
They made special accomodations for my business lunch and brought out specialty items that I had requested in advance. Awesome staff.
Perhaps it was because of Valentine's Day, but the place was over crowded. The food was fair, but not great. It looked promising, but disappointed.

It starts with the owner [wife] going by every table at least twice per dinner [I could see from our corner table]; then the other co-owner/Chef would bring I would say 1/3 of all dinners their dinner he had just cooked; another third got a stop-by and I'd say a decent grouping were welcomed at the door....this may have been 'quick', but it was an amazing thing to watch & experience!
The service by Kim was excellent. The rosotto was fair - "clumpy" - but edible. The Halibut was not cooked evenly. Still tasty.
Exceeded expectations. We really enjoyed it and have recommended it to friends.

The service and the staff were great from start to finish. However the food was below expectation. We ordered steak well done but it wasred on the inside. The steak on the kids menu was very hard and our daughter didnt eat it. The place was chilly because of the openness. Again the staff was friendly and above expectations.
Very good food at reasonable prices in a quiet residential setting with a cosy fireplace and ample parking in the evening. Try it for a special occasion.
Food was excellent and so was the service. Highly recommend this restaurant to friends.
My friend and I go here for the Guavaritas!!! By the pitcher full is a good value.

Came to Blue Hill with a semi large group this time and everythingwas excellent. Even though we were in the dining room during the Ravens' game, there was no problem, in fact we coould see the tv's when we wished and hold conversations when not. A few of us stayed late and moved to the bar itself and enjoyed the rest of the game and the rest of our evening.
This is our go to place when there is something special to celebrate or entertaining somene. It is excellent and you can always depend on that.
G00D FOOD; GOOD WINE; GOOD SERVICE - WHAT MORE DO YOU NEED?

column4: 5007 Honeygo Center Dr #101 Perry Hall, MD  21128
column13: Bombay Nights are a great addition to Perry Hall-White Marsh restaurant scence. I highly recommend you eerience the fantastic Indian cuisine.
I've been here a few times and love the food, the service, the people, and the ambience.
Enjoyed the food, the atmosphere and the service was great. Look forward to dining again soon.
Outstanding experience........just super in all ways........the food was outstanding....did not want the meal to end
The food was great, and our server was the best.
First time there. Food and service was great! The restaurant was decorated very well.
We had a great time like always

We recently had a family dinner at Caesar's Den during restaurant week. We went very early because we did have a toddler in the group and were specifically looking for a place in Little Italy that wasn't too fancy for kids. The restaurant had a few other families but was mostly quite. It had the feel of a Brooklyn old school Italian place. Everyone in our party of 7 remarked on how good the food was and that we will be returning.

The manager did not makea very good effort to find us a nice table, even though the restaurant was not very crowded. Food was good, but nothing special. My grilled cheese was disappointing as it was quite small.
Nice seemingly authentic french bistro. Enjoyabe ambiance and good, though not great food and service. Great place for a special occasion or just a change of pace.
Could not have been more pleased with the food or waitstaff. You will not be sorry.
Consistently excellent food and dining experience. Excellent in honoring reservations

I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience at Carlo's Restaurant. The food was excellent, good price point and the service was outstanding, thanks to our Waitress, Kim. It was so good that I am returning tonight with friends. Great find. Faye Johnson
It was a great experience but we were not given a rosÃ© because we were two woman and married.

We have been to this restaurant numerous time before and were always very pleased. Unfortunately, we brought other guests, new to this restaurant, thinking that we would receive the same quality food and service but were highly disappointed. The only option was the Sunday brunch, which was marginally good. Service was poor! We raved to our friends about the signature crab soup and, of course, there was none to be had! So, we were VERY disappointed and may never go back!

Had a great lunch there on a weekday. It was empty when we got there, but a pretty good lunch crowd came in while we were eating. We got the mezze trio with hummus, baba ghanoush, and ezme, which were all delicious. Our entrees (the doner sandwich, the beef kebab sandwich, and the Casablanca pide were all great. The service was very good.
Took my husband here for his birthday! He absolutely loved it! Great atmosphere, food, and service. Very upscale! We definitely plan to return!
Love this place! We come here for all special occasions. The staff is always great and friendly. Food is fantastic every time we go, we have never had anything bad here.
The food was great. Atmosphere was busy and loud and the place was packed. Service was attentive. Prices are reasonable. We will definitely be returning.

column4: 1915 Towne Centre Blvd. Ste 250 Annapolis, MD  21401
column13: Their Steaks are a little over priced for what was served, in comparison to other high end steak restaurants. The Service was outstanding and the atmosphere was enjoyable.
The food quality is superb for the price. Honestly, I don't know how they do it at these prices.
Service was very attentive. (This was the first time I've seen a waiter taste our wine before we did!) It was our 4th visit to Cinghiale. One issue - a couple of the pasta dishes were over-salted.

I took some important colleagues here for a work-related dinner. The food was excellent and the service was impeccable. It made for an impressive event. My only complaint is that they refused to provide individual checks, which can create a delicate accounting problem for business people on expense accounts. So if you are on an account, be aware that you will have to submit a large bill. Other than that, I recommend Cinghiale whole-heartedly and will definitely go back.
A regular for us, we love it. Always great food & service!
Have been here once before and love the location, the staff and the atmosphere. The food is very good

Have been here before for lunch and dinner. We've never had a bad meal here. This trip the diners had the mussel appetizer (one per couple is ample)and the salmon, filet, and chicken marsala entrees and all were very happy. Bar in the back was hopping with the Ravens-Broncos playoff game, but the dining room was relatively quiet.
We were a group 5 adults, an infant and a toddler. All except the infant ate. All enjoyed their food.
This was our first visit to the Columbia location and it certainly exceeded our expectations.
ribs outstanding and the cole slaw good too
This was not my first visit and it will certainly not be my last .. the food is outstanding.
The vegetable lasagna was great!
Our dinner was a suprising delight. Everything (well, except for the table next to us but that is not the restaurant's fault) was great. We can't wait to come back.

Crush winehouse was very good. I enjoyed the food very much. I shared three tapa like plates with my sister. We ordered the curry scallops, but they were not as spicy as I expected them to be. We also had the crab dip which was very good, but too much for only two people. The other plate was the tuna tartar. I enjoyed it the most, the ginger dressing on it tied the whole dish together. It was more than enough food for the two of us. I was very interested in the wine tasting but we were unable to try the wine dispenser. The sevrice was good. There seemed to only be two servers for the entire resturant though, so when it got busier we got overlooked a bit. All and all it was a good experience and I really enjoyed my evening.
Great place! Great food! A lot of fun, but now I have to work two jobs to pay the bill off! Lol

My friend and I arrived at 5:10 as the restaurant was supposed to be open at 5:.00. When we arrived we stood at the door waiting for someone to greet us but the staff was still vacuuming and we had to wait to be seated. The restaurant was freezing cold and we had to ask for the heat to be turned on! The server took a while to take our order and my food was fair but my friends food was awful. I would not return to this restaurant nor recommend it to anyone.
The food and Service was great.

column4: Hilton Baltimore 401 W. Pratt St. Baltimore, MD  21201
column13: Our server, Kevin, was the best. Glad he suggested the steak special. I never had a New York strip with a hand made caramel apple glaze. It was special. Next time offer the same deal using a Porterhouse steak so that we can have more!!! We had a great time.
Great night for a girls night out. We enjoyed the meal and drinks. And were able to enjoy each others company along witha having a fun full night. Good not stop laughing.
Wonderful food. Healthy and decadent at the same time.

From the time we sat down at the table, I just knew they would have amazingly delicious food to choose from. From the perfectly made cocktails and appetizers, to the main course with just the right wine, all proved to be as great a culinary experience as I had hoped and expected!! Just wish I had kept room for dessert! Maybe next time.....

Always weird for me to walk into a Mexican restaurant run by white people... food was pretty good, waiter was kind of stuffy, Sirius Mexican music started to get old after a while. If it's your thing, you'll enjoy it, Mexican food is starting to get old to me. Definitely a non traditional menu available.

We were a party of 10 (6 adults, 4 children) looking for a last minute reservation on a Saturday night. We found El Hidalgo on Open Table with good reviews and decided it try it. Our table was ready for us when we got there (the restaurant was actually very empty until later in the evening when we were leaving) and the waiter was initially very attentive. As the night wore on, and the restaurant got more crowded, the service declined. The food was okay (some in our party liked our dishes, others didn't). There isn't much to the atmosphere to this restaurant - you enter into the bar area and behind it is the dining section, which is pretty cramped - seems they've tried to cram a few too many tables into the space.
Amazing beer with average food--pretty typical for a brewpub. Skip the average restaurant upstairs and have some crab dip and a beer in the awesome basement bar.

we were there on a very slow night-it was snowing and the roads were very base. Our server was OK, but it seemed to take a long time to receive our food. The food was good, but not comparable to the prices charged. The best feature of the meal was the bouche, it was fantastic. However, there are many restaurants in the area I would rather visit, primarily due to the high cost to value relationship.

column1: Explorers - Royal Sonesta Harbor Court Baltimore
column13: The Explorer's Lounge is a relaxed, quiet venue that serves well-prepared and reasonably priced food. Since it is in our neighborhood, we tend to go there when we are in a hurry or don't want to brave the elements. On our recent visit our party of three enjoyed the salads, salmon and spaghetti. The drinks and wine tend to be more expensive than the food. The wait staff is well meaning but somewhat unsophisticated and they don't have a sense of timing, e.g. asking for your order too early. Better training might solve this problem, or, better still, have them dine at another restaurant to gain a diner's experience.

Walking distance from the Westin Hotel. We asked for a highchair in the reservation and the staff had one waiting. They seemed to position all the patrons with small children together in one area -- great idea. My wife had the corned beef and cabbage - 6 of 10 for her on the food. I had the fish & chips - very good and generous portion. Of note, there isn't a children's menu, but many appetizers work very well for children (mac & cheese, mini-burgers, etc).
The food was fantastic. Great portion sizes. I had enough for another meal.

column4: 7185 Columbia Gateway Drive Suite A Columbia, MD  21046
column13: Walked in and walked right back out. Now I know why they didn't post any pictures of this restaurant on the website. It looked more like a fast food style place. My family and I went out to celebrate my 50th. This was NOT the place to do it! Maybe another day when I'm in the neighborhood and want to try something quick.

This was our first time at Flemings and everything was wonderful. We really liked our server Tammy, in addition to outstanding service, she made great recomendations and was fun to talk to. The food was amazing! We will be back!

column1: Fogo de Chao Brazilian Steakhouse - Baltimore
column13: Don't fill up on salad, the steak is amazing!

we arrived early for our reservation and the staff was very polite and welcoming. we were directed to the bar where the bartender made sure we had a menu as well as a space at the bar, despite how busy it was. our waitress brought our food promptly and was helpful in recommending food for my wife.
We will be back. Thanks for a good meal!
The food was really good, we ordered grilled calamari, and it was perfectly cooked. The pasta was a little bit too soft for me, but the sauce was great.

Do not book the last time slot they have available. If there is something wrong with your food, you are stuck because they already begun to break down the kitchen. All I wanted was new mashed potatoes. Other than that, place is great, food was great.

most incredible Italian food outside of Italy. Small but great wine list, with lots of affordable options. The food is just spectacular. home made pasta will blow your mind. The last time I went, our party of 4 could not decide on what to order, so the chef came out of the kitchen, grabbed our menus, and said, "we will bring you food". The staff pampered us with incredible table service, and kept bringing one course after the next, refilling our wine glasses. We closed the place down, had digestivo with the chef and staff. just superb!
My wife and I have been to both locations and we love both.

column1: Grille 700 at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront
column13: Food was average, very empty for a Friday night but that might have been because it was Restaurant Week. It's a good hotel restaurant.
Great food and service, but too noisey in large dining room.

column4: 101 N. Harbor Road Saint Michaels, MD  21663
column13: This was a restaurant we thought we would try and man was it worth it. It was right off the water in a hotel so it wasn't easily distinguishable at first, but definitely go out of the way for this place.

This is our favorite restaurant in Annapolis. We first discovered it the night before we took our son to I-day in 1999 when our son wanted a great steak. The food was delicious then, and it continues to be outstanding-- the fish is so fresh, and the crab cake is the best in town! Not to mention the cream of crab soup! Yum! The menu offers nightly specials and an excellent selection of choices to satisfy all palates.The ambience is wonderful, very inviting, and comfortable with attractive artifacts and artwork representing Annapolis throughout its history.There is a wonderful bar upstairs as well - perfect for pre or after dinner libation!Harry Browne's has it all!
The food is wonderful in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Love it!

I've been here before, and I do recommend it. This time, I had the shrimp salad sandwich. It was really good, not overdressed. It comes with field greens, which is a nice alternative to fries. I also ordered the Brussels sprouts. They were good in terms of removing the bitterness, but I thought they were maybe a little too rich. My sister strongly recommends the burger.
much better than it used to be. great meal, great service, great view!
Love the food and ambience - it's a little annoying that they are "strict" about substitutions. They want you to eat it the way it's supposed to be served, but...
I had Oysters Rockefeller Pot Pie. It was a treat. It was the sort of meal that sets one free. The food at the High Spot tells the truth!

We enjoy dining at the Hipp Cafe. The food is always, always good. It is served in a timely manner and the people there are friendly and eager to help.The only negative is that 2 of the ladies working wanted to move our table (of 2) next to a wall and the water fountain...they thought it would be too crowded where the table was to begin with. They didn't even ask us if we wanted to move our table....they just picked it up and moved it. We did ask if we could sit where the table was orginially and they said yes and moved the table back.
Totally loved this restaurant - was the highlight of our weekend in OC. Great drinks, food and service. We will be heading there again when we return or Ocean City in the summer.
Really awesome and economical Sunday brunch at this restaurant. My only irritation was the "tip jar" for the omelet cookers. I am getting tired of tipping every single person that does their job.

What a gem! I hate to give it such a glowing review because I want to keep it all for myself. Seriously, these are super-nice folks who serve terrific food in a warm and inviting place. It's one of the best finds we've made in several years.
great food and ambience ay India's! highly recommended!

Food was BAD . Veg kabab said Paneer but not 1 piece was found I got 3 brokoli 1 huge cut in half onion1 suspicious looking green leaf. I am Indian so I know what to expect when I see the menuI waited 45 mins to get order and drink . 2 servers on 8-10 tableIt was Valentin eve so for pricy and prefix menu they took another 45 minMany of the menu was unavailable . I was there at 8 so it is not as if they ran out of stuff at 11Inspite of that they were allowing folks .Dessert was missed the poor tired waiter was too tired to apologizeOver all bad... Place interior is good However the site is deceiving .I will never go back it is boaring placeAs if sitting in a banquet hall with strengers TOTAL RIP OFF

column4: 10435 State Route 108 also known as Clarksville Pike Columbia, MD  21044
column13: A delightful place to meet friends.

column1: James Joyce Irish Pub and Restaurant
column13: Food was pretty good. Potato soup was well seasoned and flavorful. NY Strip was cooked to perfect temperature and tender. Bailey's chocolate cake was a bit dry, but still a good way to end the meal. Our waiter was a bit inattentive and failed at being humorous multiple times. Offered more bread, which we never received. Noise level was very high, making it hard to carry out a conversation with my wife directly across the table from me.

I cannot recommend this restaurant. Although the server was pleasant, the service was spotty. We waited quite awhile for appetizers. Not everyone was served their appetizer at the same time. The two first courses were brought out together, rather one after the other. The crab and asparagus soup was terrible - the crab was off. The waiter said he took it off the bill, but I saw no evidence of that. We will not be back.
Had a great time and great food.

Excellent crab cakes. Some of the best ever. No need for the side sauce. The sauce was used in the crab cake simply to hold the together b/c there was so much lump meat. Two were very filling!! Great portions. Crab nachos were yummy too. Can't go wrong here regardless of what you order.

column4: 11805 Coastal Highway Ste N Ocean City, MD  21842
column13: A small French restaurant in OC. Possibly the best restaurant in OC.

Ambiance was out of this world, but the entrees my girlfriend and I ordered were not worth what they charged. I think I could have made scallops and risotto as well as they did. Overall though, good for a special occasion. Also, the wine list was unreal.

The crab dishes at Kentmorr were delicious. The waitree, Lisa, was plesant, kind and attentive, obviously someone who cares about her customers. The ambiance was of that of a slower-paced, long-gone era, where folks relaxed and enjoyed good food and good company in a casual atmosphere. Worth the drive over the bridge for taste and value alone.
Bar tending staff wasnt adequate for a busy night.

column1: Kumari Restaurant and Bar - Locust Point
column13: The food is excellant and the staff was very attentive without being overbearing. My husband and I have been several times and it is always good. The last night we went was very bad with snow and ice but they were doing many take out orders and deliveries.

column1: Kumari Restaurant and Bar - Mt. Vernon
column13: Great Indian Food. Nothing exceptional...but very good. Service was good. Prices very reasonable.
Veal was undercooked, overall food was good but not fantastic. Service was not the best

We got a lovely table overlooking the harbor. Very romantic. Many interesting varieties of Sangria; we tried a delightful peach Sangria. The 2 of us shared 7 different tapas. all were very good. Less inspiring were the desserts. Service was prompt. All in all, a very enjoyable evening.
As soon you walked in the door the service was prompt, courteous and non-intrusive.
The food here is excellent! They serve biscuits and corn bread before the meal- delicious!
The food was excellent and the customer service by both the manager who helped us find a parking place and our excellent waiter, Derrick.

column4: 209 North Washington Street Havre De Grace, MD  21078
column13: A Great place that we just discovered. Went there for lunch but will go back again for dinner and other meals. Located in Havre de Grace, Maryland, located in the downtown historic city area gave it a great feel, and the downtown is nice. And it is close to the water, so walking around before or after your meal will be good.
Delicious. Attentive staff. Stylish decor. They were very nice to my children.

Authentic French menu and food in downtown Annapolis - the smell of real butter as you walk in. Attentive and knowledgeable staff. Artichoke vinaigrette and bouilabaisse for me; half lobster salad and calves liver for my husband. Will definitely go again!

We had made the reservations a couple of weeks in advance. Upon arriving at the restaurant the two of us were directed to a table for four directly in front of the main door. Their was a table for two open in a nice location. I requested that table. I was told that is was not available. I asked why. They called the manager to the front to talk to us. I once again requested the table for two. I was again told that it had three reservations back to back. I responded by saying that I was not aware that you could reserve a certain table. The manager said you can't, so once again I requested that table. After all we were there and the table was empty. Why couldn't they put us at that table. We were told no.

Linwoods has always been my favorite restaurant, NOW it is my favorite spot to have a party! With Rachael's expert planning skills, Christa and Tim's outstanding serving style, and Shawn's superb cooking techniques......my guests and I had an unforgettable dining experience. Hats off to Linwood and his extraordinary staff for a job well done. Can't wait to plan another event at Linwoods.

We enjoyed everything that we ordered. The butternut soup was wonderful. While my husband ordered the main entree of sea scallops, the waiter suggested I could order the appetizer size if I wanted a smaller portion size which was just perfect for me and let me enjoy the side dish of beets. Our waiter was great and very attentive. We are looking forward to returning there for their brunch when it begins.

The wine list is interesting. It comes in a sub-divided recipe box. Big selection! The house salad dressing is too lemony. Ask for a taste of it on the side. The filet mignon was good perfectly (MR for me and MW for the hubby).

we were soexcited to try this new restaurant based on previous diner reviews. How disappointed were we. They decided to extend restaurant week so there was a limted prix fix menu. Portions were small and all served in a scoop. Short ribs terrible and grits like cement

The six of us were quite pleased with the service, atmosphere and food. I ordered the Rockfish entree, which measures up to the best I have had. I received compliments from all for finding this neighborhood restaurant. We will definitely dine with Luna Blu again.

The restaurant was very empty for 7:30. We were seated next to a large table of girls who were very talkative and loud. Our server was too busy with them, so the guy who poured our waters came and took our drink order, and then eventually became our server for the night. He was great - no complaints there.The food was so-so. I got the crabcake which was pretty good. My bf got the steak, which was very dry and even our server recommended A1. For such an expensive place, I would say the food should be of better quality.
The food was good alil pricey but the steak was great had a coupon from the hotel we were at, so it was a discount but all in all great would def go again .....

Saturday night was packed, but our waiter was great, kept us apprised of what was happening with our meal. Good pacing of the courses considering how busy it was. Very good service, friendly and efficient (as always). A couple of our entrees were a little dry; the food is generally just perfect on past visits for lunch & dinner. But still great experience, kid friendly & nice wine selection for the food offered, enough space between tables even when all rooms are filled, accomodating of special requests. And our waiter got us out to see in time to see our play. Separate sports bar area option is very lively.
Limited menu did not grab me, initially. However, execution was flawless and food was outstanding! These guys can cook - highly recommended!

column4: 30415 Cedar Neck Road Ocean View, DE  19970
column13: Was very disappointed in our dining experience. Magnolias has a casual bar environment on the first floor and a white table cloth fine dining environment on the upper level. We were seated in the bar area and felt like we were at a tailgate rather than an upscale dining event we were looking for. Plus our waitress was unable did not know how to open a wine bottle.
Maisy's was awesome! Had a huge group and they took great care of us! Would absolutely frequent again. YUM! Pizzas are DELICIOUS!!

Our dinners were expertly prepared with the distinct flavors of Italian sauces. The only complaint we had was that our order arrived so quickly it appeared that we were being pressured to leave so that they could turn the table. With that exception, dining at Maria's was a very pleasant experience.
I was aprehensive over the resevation as there were lots of comments about poor service but the greeting, service and food were outstanding. We will be back again.

Mason's had a menu for almost everyone with interesting specials - how about delicious meat loaf or arctic char with 10 vegetables? Also, fresh oysters on the half-shell and desserts that taste as good as they look - the carrot cake is the best we've ever had!

This has been my second time dining at this restaurant. Both times, it has been amazing. From the atmosphere, to the servers, to the food. Everything was great! When it's warm out, it's great to dine outside by the water. Service was great and food was fantastic. Me and the girlfriend cannot wait to go back!
Celebrated our daughters 13th birthday there. Perfect setting, fun experience, good food.
Steak and cake were very good. Better than the average hotel restaurant. The service was excellent until they started to get busy, then had to wait awhile for our bill. I would go there again.

The Milton Inn is one of my favorite restaurants. It is a little pricey so my wife and I only go there for special occasions. The food is fantastic and service is second to none. This restaurant is the only place that the lobster tastes any good to me.

The service was excellent here - everyone was accommodating, knowledgeable and friendly. Our food, the vegetable platter and chicken/kofta combo, was filling and a good price for the size. Everything was flavorful and authentic. The atmosphere was energetic, with children of various ages enjoying themselves, and a diverse group of people were present. I plan to return again soon and would recommend it to a friend.
You can never go wrong at Morton's in Baltimore. The food is always fabulous and the staff is very friendly and attentive.
Always a great place to dine. I've been to Mountain Branch about a dozen times now and I've never been disappointed.
I LOVE this restaurant. The food is wonderful, the drinks are fabulous, and the atmosphere is absolutely great. This is a good place for a foodie.

Nantuckets is a habit of ours when we head to the beach. It's hard to pass up the Sunday night specials for $19. The menu is varied and hard to narrow. Such great seafood and excellent steaks, the atmosphere is sophisticated beach scene, a little dress up but casual personality. Great wait staff. Nice when Dawson stops by for a visit. We'll be back often, we promise. Love the Lobster Shanty as well.
Server was attentive. Food was great. Not my first time there. Will be back again.
Food is great, German beer selection is outstanding. Try the goulash.

We had a wonderful meal, six of us. Food was great, appetizers were delicious - we got the crispy fried oysters and the scallops in polo doe - fantastic. Crab cakes and seafood/Alfredo pasta was shared between me and the lady and both were prepared perfectly. Bread pudding and a special birthday cake deserts were the perfect finish. I had a malbbec wine - the lady a Chilean chardonnay. All in all, couldn't't have been better.
Food was excellentt. We had lobster and salmon and were so full we had no room for dessert.

column4: 20786 Rock Hall Avenue Rock Hall, MD  21661
column13: We sat right in front of the fire and the waitress was always very near and attentive. The food was very good. It was very relaxing and romantic.

Even though we don't get here as often as I'd like this is my favorite restaurant in Easton. I could happily live on the mezze plate alone for days on end, it is THAT good. That and the crispy polenta are my favorite dishes at OTF. My husband who is more of a meat eater loves dining here, too. Their Mission Statement says it all. Don't hesitate to try this wonderful, thoughtful restaurant.

Oxford Greens is a wonderful little restaurant on a back street in the lovely town of Easton, MD. Set in a quaint, brink, former neighborhood grocery, the restaurant is decorated to resemble and antiques/paintings gallery. The food is exquisite. The hanger steak was perfectly done with wonderful seasonings, the home-made baquettes to die for---light and crispy. The chocolate mousse cake for dessert was to die for. Can't say enough about this little place. With several $19.95 prix fixe dinners on the menu each night, its easy to have a special dinner without budget-busting.
Best Izakaya in Baltimore/DC area.

column4: 2105 Laurel Bush Rd #108 Bel Air, MD  21015
column13: I believe that your restaurant is the best in BelAir when it comes to service, quality of food and wine. In my opinion you offer the best dinning experience in the area..

A common fav of our family. Unfortunately this trip we had poor service having to struggle to find our waiter for water refills and wait for him to clear off all his other tables before we could get his attention for our check. The place had only a handful of customers at the time of our visit so he was not that busy. The other problem we had was that our appetizers came to our table and one minute later our main orders arrived - a pet peeve of mine.

column4: 104 West Green Street Snow Hill, MD  21863
column13: First time at the Palette. We selected a bottle of wine. Our waitress (Priscilla) asked us if we would like water. She didn't bring it until we reminded her of it later in the meal. We didn't like the fact that you have to pay for bread. We still find it to be a turn off. We both ordered the filet, were not given a steak knife, however it was juicy and tender enough that we didn't need one. There were other tables getting more attention than we were, seemed they were regulars. We ended up having to wait over 20 minutes to get our change. Our waitress forgot to bring it, then it was given to the wrong table. Our food was great, yes to Oysters Casino. Overall, the food was excellent, the service lacking for the caliber of the restaurant.
Pappas staff couldn't have been more accomodating. We loved our vist, great crab cake, excellent fish entree. Headed back today!
Fantastic food and service. They were very good with a food allery and making my wife feel safe.

Always have fun at Pazo's. Nick, the manager, and our server took extraordinary care of us. Our group goes to Pazo for birthday celebrations and we always look forward to our little booth, the delicious food, and great ambiance. The restaurant and the staff never let's us down!

column1: Peacock Restaurant & Lounge at The Inn at 202 Dover
column13: We went for an early New Year's Eve dinner. The restaurant is beautiful. The food was outstanding. Our guests were very pleased with everything (as were we).
This is one of our very favorite restaurants in the area. The food is always good and the service is great.

Food was ok. Not what I expected for a place with 30 years' experience. Stuffed mushrooms tasty but mushy on the bottom. Mac and cheese had a funny taste and was waaaay overpriced for the amount. Mussels were super, but we were not given a bowl for shell discards.We were given a table right by the kitchen door, so we missed all the "ambiance" of the place.Basically, an ok experience, but I will not be eating at Phillips again.Also, acoustic tile or something is needed--the place is so noisy, we could barely hear our waitress.
Kitchen exhaust system needs attention.

They did not reserve a table for us. We specifically reserved one because it was NFL playoffs. The hostess made us wait 15 minutes to put a table out on the patio ( which did have heater....but it was a real lousy location. We found a hightop in the bar right near the entrance instead. The waiter was great and food was mosstly good......but very dissapointed in the attitude of the staff concerning our reservation.

column1: Pope's Tavern at the Oxford Inn
column13: We enjoyed the well prepared food and speical service that was provided for our birhtday dinner. The duck was espeically good as well as the steak.
This is a Harford County best kept secret! Food is always good! Willing to customize your dinner if you have special requests!
We always enjoy dining at the Prime Rib. They always make it an enjoyable evening.

column1: The Prime Rib at Maryland Live! Casino
column13: Great place to enjoy the moment of life without the worry of the world. Stop and smell the roses and allow the wonderful wait staff to take care of your every need

Two out of three 'ain't bad.' Pusser's is the place to go for their famed Painkiller drinks and and drinks containing Pusser's rum, in general. Dinner has always been mediocre at best and reliably leaves us flat. The desserts are at least good. This restaurant is all about having an experience where you eat by the water. We've never had a memorable dish, unfortunately. Luckily, the water view creates experiences, otherwise.
Nice menu selection, good food, service was very good.
Cream of crab soup was excellent, after that the dinner went down hill. The wings were watery my steak was funny tasteing my wife's chicken Chesapeake was flavorless.
Adam, Kohl and crew served an amazing dinner, as usual!
Best Crabcakes in Baltimore - hands down!

I knew that Reynolds Tavern is historic and a well-known place for Lunch, Afternoon Tea,and Dinner. Enjoying their Valentine's Day prix fixe dinner was a real treat for me and My Love. Grewat food and marvelous service. Remember the historic aspect and don't expect huge windows and water views. However, the view of ST. Anne's Church and the Maryland State House from our table was wonderful.
Service was excellent. The staff treats everyone like their best friend!

Went for valentines day. They had our rservation and we were seated quickly. My date and I shared the Bison burger and Rockfish entre. The burger was outstanding. The rockfish was disappointing for the $32 price. Very small portion and a bit dry. Their menu is limited. If I go back it will be for lunch.
ALL 8 OF US ENJOYED THE FOOD VERY MUCH.

The app's were great. The sushi roll we selected was very fresh and delicious. Unfortunately, we then had the entrees. My fiancee selected the Roy's trio and I selected the Shellfish Sampler. Both plates were small portions and lacked flavor. We've heard great things about the Butterfish. It was included in the trio dish, but the fish lacked flavor and was overcooked. The shellfish sampler included a crab cake and small lobster tail. Both tasted like a frozen seafood dish you'd get from the grocery store. Again, the app's were great. But, this place is not worth spending big bucks for a full dinner. Great for happy hour! Go across the street for dinner.

This place was super cute!!! I mean a true hidden gem!!! My wife picked this place for Valentine's Day so the menu was limited and we ALMOST left (so glad we didn't)!!!! We had the rockfish and lamb and it was so so so good... and since the restaurant wasn't packed at all... it seemed like we had the whole place to ourselves. I can't wait to go back and try their regular menu.

Such a romantic restaurant! Portion sizes could be larger. The chicken added was barely noticable. Waiter was kind to surprise my Mom with a slice of cheesecake with candle for her birthday, but didn't ask if we wanted dessert until after my Mom shared her cheesecake. Dessert was delicious!
This was not our first time here. I always feel I will enjoy it.
I enjoyed the services and the food so much that i turned around and brought my children the following Saturday.
Sad to say I haven't been at sabatinos for a long time but it has died. It went from the best at little Italy to a Chinese carry out with nasty food.
Great service, great restaurant, great atmosphere but one of the things we ordered was a little bland- but the rest of the food was delicious.

Food was good, as always. However, a very large group and other large tables contributed to not only a noisy evening but a very long wait for our meal. First time we've ever had a less than positive dining experience here.

column4: 2020 Chesapeake Harbour Drive East Annapolis, MD  21403
column13: Best fried oysters we ever had -- and we've had many. Strawberry-chocolate chip muffins were a tasty treat before the meal.
My wife and I really enjoyed our dinner at Sascha's over the weekend. The shrimp and grits was amazingly good. Will be going back soon.
We had a great lunch, first time there, we'll be back in the summer !!

We had an absolute horrible experience at Serafino's. There were 7 of us. To start off with the restaurant ran out of bread which served complimentary, so our server offended us garlic bread with an additional charge. The entree had no flavor whatsoever. No one in our group finished there food. And our server was too occupied with the bar tender to find out how the food was. On enthe check arrived we had to wait so long to pick up our credit card that we got tired of waiting and left cash on the table. I would never go ba k to this place againand will never recommend it to anyone.
This was my second celebration occasion that I chose this location for and just the like the first it was an excellent experience.

column4: 3410 Plum Tree Dr Ellicott City, MD  21042
column13: Nice spot for our family night out. We hadn't been in a while and the menu had changed dramatically since our last visit a few years back. Less fresh fish options was disappointing but we still enjoyed our meal. The service was great and the place was packed by the time we left.
Wonder, friendly service at every meal. Check-in was very friendly. All the extra touches in our room were very nice.

column4: 320 Blenheim Lane Havre De Grace, MD  21078
column13: We had a wonderful, quick but not rushed, relaxing time.

It's a place I would like to like more. But there's just something about it. Great facility. Very stylish, easy parking, great for conversation. It can be uncomfortably cold, possibly due to ultra high ceiling and glass walls to the outside.
This is now my new best restaurant to go to for Italian food. I have already arranged to take some friends there next month.

Stanford Grill is not cheap, but it's a consistently tasty menu that has become a staple for us. From the rotisserie chicken, ribs, and crab cakes to all their amazing beef selections, you can't go wrong. Even their salads and sandwiches are amazing. And those desserts...
It was my first time visiting the resturant and overall it was a very good experience. I would recommend friends and family.

column4: 1 East Pratt Street Suite 100 Baltimore, MD  21202
column13: Sullivan was great. My fiancee and I enjoyed it.

column4: 3408 Red Rose Farm Rd Bowleys Quarters, MD  21220
column13: Very good food and excellent service. Although it was a bit crowded in the dining room, our server handled everything professionally and pleasantly without showing any angst.
The service was excellent. The wine list was reasonably priced. The rockfish cooked in salt was original and delicious.We would definitely go again!

TEN TEN was a ton of fun. We started out at the bar and enjoyed amazing cocktails. Then we had wonderful apps, dinner, and dessert at a table. The lobster mac & cheese app was wonderful, and the scallops with succotash entree was fantastic. The desserts were also really tremendous. I was WOWed by the wine list. There were some quite unique wines available by the glass and bottle.

This is always a special place in which to dine! Attentive staff, lovely setting, creative food. In the "garden room" one feels like one has really gotten away from it all for a while. I have been coming here off and on for 20 years.

column4: 407 South Talbot Street Saint Michaels, MD  21663
column13: We love the food, the wait staff, Chef Harly and owner Chris - all of whom make it the special "go to" restaurant in St. Michaels - Theo's sets the level of the "bar" at the top!
Great food and great service! I recommend it to anyone in the Tilghman area.

column4: 201 E Pratt St. The Gallery at Harborplace Baltimore, MD  21202
column13: We went early in the evening - loved the service and of course, the food. I am Irish, so I enjoyed the flavour of the place.
Townhouse was outstanding! Food was wonderful and the atmosphere was incredible... Half round booths for groups equipped with beer and vodka taps. Great for a night out with friends.
Really needs to pick up their game - they can not use the excuse of just opening any longer and they need to start doing right - Management really needs to do something soon or it will be to late
With most of the seating open my wife and I sat between two groups of 4 and the noise got so loud we could not hear each other. Aside from the seating arrangement the experience was very good.

Had Christmas dinner here and it was excellent. We had 4 entirely different entrees and sides. All were well prepared and attractively plated. You can view the dessert selections when you enter. The staff is very friendly and our waiter, Luis, was a joy.

I visited during restaurant week and had a reservation. However, my friends and I still had to wait 30 minutes to be seated. The bartender that served us while we were waiting for a table was very nice. The space was very cramped, although the decor and ambiance was nice and homey. We had to climb over the bottom stair which stuck out into the seating area to get to our seats, which was a little odd. As for the food, my salad was good, the pizza was okay (I thought there was too much crust and it was too salty), and the tiramisu was also good. My boyfriend received the wrong pizza even though the server repeated what he said after he ordered it, but they were quick to fix it and bring out the one he had ordered.

Been going here for years. Extensive beer menu, consistently excellent food and service. Fresh local ingredients including some from Victoria's own garden. Although limited menu, options are creative and well prepared. Portions are just right with more focus on quality instead of huge portions.

column4: 142 N. Washington St. Havre De Grace, MD  21078
column13: Very extensive wine list by the glass. Flatbreads were very good.
Not a large selection in terms of entrees
Great service, great food, we hope they put the lobster and crab bisque on the permanent menu!

Had such a wonderful time here. I took my recently engaged friends out to celebrate and we had such a lovely dinner. Our waitress was wonderful and our food was incredible. I fully plan on frequenting Waterstone often!

column4: 202 East Pratt Street Located @ 5th Floor of the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel Baltimore, MD  21202
column13: We enjoyed our brunch at the Watertable. The quality and selection of food for brunch was impressive and included everything from traditional breakfast foods to an Easter Eurpean fish spread. The only downside was that they had one person working the omlett/ waffle station while a second one was set-up but unmanned. The line and wait for omletts left our family skipping the station. We were there for about an hour and the line never receceeded.

Overall good in most areas, however the server (in this case a foreign-accented dough boy) couldn't grasp the order correctly. My girlfriend ordered the lump crab cakes (and pointed to them on the menu) - the waiter asked if she wanted the benedict to which she clarified "No, I want this one, JUST the crab cakes" and pointed. He brought out an Eggs Benedict sans crab cakes. We sent this back and clarified the order. 10 minutes later we received a crab cake sandwich and started laughing. The waiter became very defensive both times and tried to argue. There were 4 people at the table who heard the order loud and clear. In retrospect I should have talked to the manager. My guess is based on his demeanor he had done this several times before.
Wild Orchid is one of my favorites. The food is seasonal and local.

Went with the wife for V-Day. Food was excellent, service attentive without being annoying, lighting enough to see and eat by, but not overwhelming. Can't wait to go back and try the regular menu, but the V-Day menu was worth every penny and comparatively it was not expensive...

The restaurant is large but cozy thanks to the wood burning fireplace and sofas. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable and the goal seems to be perfection.We enjoyed a fabulous meal and will definitely visit again!

Woodberry Kitchen is out absolute favorite restaurant. The servers are very knowledgable, the ambience is amazing and the food is sustainable,local and organic. Everything is high quality and creative without being pretentious. It's amazing!
cozy and charming ambiance with mellow jazz. signature bloody mary with Old Bay seasoning around the rim of the glass - yum!
